_header: The head of the image is steadfast faith
_description: The interpretation of Nebuchadnezzar’s vision of the image — fourteen couplets in a Latin text

OxfCCC132.First Lines:
The hed off þe ymage ys stedfast fayth & me[r]velus
                    greteTo godys byddyng & holy kyrke ay Sogete…
OxfCCC132.Last Lines:
…The fete & þe leggys as slaw & ful heuyTo god
                    warkys all way frowarde & vnlusty
OxfCCC132.Note: Separate couplets intermingled in Latin prose.

BLLan344.First Lines:
Te hede of þis ymage is stedescast ffayth & mekenesse
                    greteTo goddis biddinge & holi kyrke ay sogette…
BLLan344.Last Lines:
…The fete & þe leggis are slaw & ful heuiTo goode
                    werkys al wey froward & unlusti
BLLan344.Note:
Written as prose and rubricated. Folios have been re-numbered to include
                    the flyleaves, and foliation here refers to the new numbers.
